title: [Large-Scale] Knowledge Management-Based Integrated Mathematics Learning Object Project

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of basic mathematical concepts and experience with digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Learners experience creating, evaluating, and integrating reusable digital learning objects to solve real-world math problems, contributing to an organized knowledge-sharing system through application of knowledge management lifecycle models

learning_goals: Learners design and develop three or more reusable learning objects for mathematical problem-solving.

Learners must classify ten provided learning objects according to the five stages of the knowledge management lifecycle (creation–evaluation–categorization–storage–utilization) using an evaluation rubric (accuracy, utility, accessibility), tag metadata, and systematically store them in a digital repository with 80% accuracy.

Learners must collaborate with 2–3 peers to produce a 3–5-minute video or PPT explaining a math concept (e.g., functions, equations, statistics) and achieve an average score of 4 or higher on a 5-point rubric during peer evaluation.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
